intro: Chrysopsis aspera, commonly known as the rough chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and yellow to orange composite flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Chrysopsis aspera is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
